title: What does 30 n mean in science? - Quora

response.answer_text: What does 30 n mean in science? It has a specialized meaning in industrial chemistry (see Amos Scott’s comment here), but it is not part of the SI set of units. Units (in the SI) other than five of the seven base units (m, kg, s, cd, mol) all consist of, or begin with, a capital letter. (The base units that follow this rule are the kelvin and the ampere, K and A respectively.) Examples include the tesla (symbol: T) and the pascal (symbol: Pa). You may be thinking of the force unit, the newton; its symbol is N, not n.
It has no meaning in reality - at best it could be read as 30 nano……. but the nano has to have some SI unit appended to make some sense .
